metadata.title: CVE-2020-15437 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before version 5.8 is vulnerable to a NULL pointerdereference indrivers/tty/serial/8250/8250_core.c:serial8250_isa_init_ports() that allowslocal users to cause a denial of service by using the p->serial_in pointerwhich uninitialized.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1067-gke - 4.15.0-1067.70
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1094-oem - 4.15.0-1094.104
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1068-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1068.72
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1084-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1084.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1025-gke - 5.4.0-1025.25~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1001-gkeop - 5.4.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1005-dell300x - 4.15.0-1005.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
